intro: Lissocarpa uyat, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Lissocarpa uyat is often found in desert environments and is considered a hardy, resilient species.
